gSglLYG86_gXyvSKIPqilw.text: The food was solid and the service was great. They did mess up our order but then they apologized and gave us free appetizers :)  Don't go out of your way to come here but if you're in the area then stop by!

1-Eu7_XD73pxs3zEYdKRHw.text: Ehh this place isn't the best option, unfortunately. I really wanted to like it, but it took them 20 mins to take our order, and we waited quite a long time. The food tasted burned and bland.

4ffeNtzFRXIhFi80DnnyBg.text: Early evening during the Festival, and I was in need of some fast food before a show. This place looked like just the ticket and as they had several veggie options available, I thought I'd give it a try.   The service was fast and attentive without being in-your-face, and although I don't think the food would win any awards in a Thai cooking competition, it was okay and quite reasonably priced. This is not somewhere I'd return to if I was looking for a good Thai meal, but for a quick noodle fix it does the job.

PzSAF5YZtJqJhkYMMfvwGg.text: Great food and service!  Ordered Egg drop soup which had a great flavor. Will return when back in the area.

kYlMf5pYmswrAYoE7ib2fQ.text: We wanted to get a quick bite to eat and came across this resto. I love Asian food because I'm Asian. Haha! Both my husband and I ordered egg fried rice and egg rolls.  The egg fried rice was good. The egg rolls need to be cooked a little bit more because you don't see the the brown color of the wrapper. They looked like they were still raw but they weren't. They tasted alright. I am.convinced that this resto's market is the younglings because the music is so loud and they were playing hip hop and dance club type of music. One of the staff was busy sampling ice cream. Either she tried 3 different flavors or 3 same flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle'N'Ice - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

2Y8uvguMQAo1uOyNM_9CXQ.text: I unfortunately have to give noodle n ice only two stars.  I've been here before and it had been very good but unfortunately tonight it was lacking to say the least.  Instead of the flat chow fun noodles it came with skinny noodles.  There was a burnt taste to the chicken and the whole dish in general.  On the menu it clearly states the dish cost 9.95 but I was charged 10.95.  When I brought this up the server said it was a misprint on the menu.   The menu states that the pad see ew is one of their signature dishes.  I would have to disagree.

RkzFuVFN9f6qFqOzT0ijWg.text: We finally want to have some Asian food after traveling around for days. The Singapore noodle is tasty and big! The area is clean and modern.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle'N'Ice - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Ej_-mV9tPGQ8cN9yteXBww.text: I know there's a part of you that's inching towards trying this place, but listen to me when I warn you: Don't do it. Don't do it. Just don't even think about it.  The smells are delicious, but very deceiving when it comes to my experience with Noodle 'N Ice. My friend and I decided to give this place a try since we've both passed it and hadn't tried it during our time in Edinburgh. I ordered the Pad See Ew and my friend ordered a soup. She originally wanted the Tom Kha, but when asked whether or not it had coconut milk (as it wasn't listed as an ingredient), the waitress said no. Subsequently, we were left puzzled. Coconut milk is a main ingredient in this Thai staple, and yet it was missing. This should have been a warning sign. But did we listen? No. Our stomachs reasoned that since we were there, we might as well give it a shot, convincing us to stay.  I went ahead and ordered my Pad See Ew and what I got back was a box full of noodles drenched in fish sauce and over seasoned vegetables. The amount of sodium I consumed in one bite was enough to clog my arteries. It was preposterous. I was dumbfounded because it was obvious the chef didn't taste his creation--a very troubling habit when you're heavy handed with the fish sauce. I was appalled.   So there you have it. Take my warning and go with it. You can stay for the smells. The smells are free. But if you're thinking about placing an order, be careful as you tread these salty waters.

RvA5zsLp2Jap7_mjZnJe9g.text: The most horrendous experience I have ever had in any type of food establishment - and I've been to countless in numerous countries, from street food and fast-food joints to Michellin-starred restaurants. I have just arrived in Edinburgh with my elderly parents, we thought this would be a nice place to grab a bit at, but my father was mistreated in the most absurd manner by the waitress (Marilyn, as per receipt) - who clearly should not be allowed to work in any environment in which there's any kind of contact with customers. She mocked my father, said he doesn't know how to speak English - not only an unacceptable thing to say, but also unTrue! He may not be fully proficient as I am (and I was there to help), but oddly enough, the waitress' English is actually much worse - not that it should matter at all, but quite interesting, considering her mockery of my dad. The waitress was incredibly impatient, rushed us to choose something within five seconds after informing us that they didn't have the lambchops my father had ordered ten minutes prior... And then she got confused with our order (not a problem, it happens), but tried to blame it on my parents, as if implying they are senile or something, asides from mocking my father's English. We cancelled the orded altogether and paid for the water that we had drank. We told the only other employee who was there, a polite waiter, about the incident, but this report seriously needs to reach the owner. This experience almost ruined the first day of our vacation, and people - especially paying customers - should not be disrespected, EVER. We are very polite people and were going to stay there for the meal despite the waitress' clear impatience, but that person clearly dislikes human beings, and the way she treated my elderly dad escalated, so we left. Simply appalling.

ZBdgPOZkigZPyqwMom4haA.text: They use fresh ingredients, but the flavor is lacking. We stopped in for a quick bite to eat because it smelled delicious, but I wish we had kept walking.

OXf-K0IZmFJyOnMKLBIMkw.text: Maybe it's because I'm half Thai, so my standards are quite high, but I also noticed the two Scottish gentlemen sitting next to me didn't finish the in their words, "tasteless" food.  I really wanted to like this place.  The menu and the atmosphere of the restaurant all seemed promising, but the food generally lacked in flavor.  My friend and I ordered the Pad Khing Chicken, Tom Yum Goong, and Chicken Fried Rice..all disappointing.  Tom Yum was flavorless, Pad Khing was overly watery and sweet (could be mistaken for a soup), and the fried rice..mushy..poorly seasoned.  Really wanted to like this restaurant, but will definitely have to pass next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle'N'Ice - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pad Khing Chicken, Tom Yum Goong, Chicken Fried Rice. Disappointing.

0LpMooTBtwDDu36Zhwlxhw.text: I would like to give it 5 stars. This is really delicious Thai food. The price is also very reasonable. Always recommend this place.

Tk7t5O0wAzyh1XY0gjatgA.text: Noodle 'n' Ice opened up in August or so and looked like a modern Asian fusion and Thai influenced place with reasonable prices. They have long communal tables and are a bit like Wagamama. I was needing a quick bite to eat before heading to the Yelp Shimmy Hug evening tonight so I popped in for some soup. I had the Tom Kha traditional Thai soup with coconut soup which sounded lovely. It was really reasonable at 3.50 but it wasn't particularly coconutty and had a different, hard to place flavour of the broth. The chicken and mushrooms were ok but there were little green shoots that were fibrous and didn't seem edible or at least digestible. It wasn't to my taste. I'd perhaps come back to try the Thai green curry or noodles but it's too bad they don't seem to do lunch prices. It's more of a lunch type of place anyway and was really quiet at dinnertime.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle'N'Ice - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tom Kha soup
Photo of Noodle'N'Ice - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Noodle'N'Ice - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu! (Double-sided with one for food and one for drinks - noodle and ice but there&#39;s more too!)

XSU6pgMNLazq0X5UZvWUwA.text: The best thing here is probably the tap water. If they sold these food in asia, they would be put in communal prison for serving life threatening food only the nonexistent animals living in the Dead Sea could eat. Only tourists spotted here.

xS_fkEnkF5GdmMOjMql3Zg.text: Can't even talk about the food, it seems great but I crossed the road and eat at another restaurant after waiting for an hour. Awful service! Still receiving customers while none was served in the whole room for an hour! No excuse, no informations... Very disappointing!

juUvm_mBtm8yL7cbBiH0aw.text: I am a traveler , and while in Edinburgh for just a day I tried this restaurant as the menu included my favorite stir fry , Thai cashew nut ( pad med mammoung ). This included a Japanese style steamed rice. I have had this dish in hundreds of Thai restaurants including Bangkok , and this was one of the very best I have ever had. I chose the prawn version , but any choice of meat or vegetable would be exceptional. Very satisfying !

48uAJ4mabKLYM2uV3jacJg.text: Went here for lunch and it was very expensive for what we got, which was certainly not a very authentic thai meal. It was more the quality of a mediocre Chinese takeaway.   The ordering process was unclear, and the staff were disinterested and rude. I won't be coming back.

Xf8Pdr8vxgJzOfYdjJylgw.text: I liked my noodle soup but the chicken should be tender this tasted like fast food. Ice cream or noodles - both seem confusing. Be the best at one thing. I will be surprised if the shop makes a go of it. Too bad. Nice decor, good staff, and decent soup.

hA3FLNov2bxAVO8z8slp-g.text: I'm surprised this place only has a few reviews! I ate here several times during my summer in Edinburgh. I especially enjoyed the pad thai and green curry chicken. The servers are very friendly. All in all, a reasonably priced option for thai fusion style food.
